title: Agency
description:
Decide who it is you work for. Are they a black-budget government department, a secret military unit, a clandestine police team, a private individual's crusade, a corporation, a scientific team, or what?

Is the Agency's goal to: destroy monsters, study the supernatural, protect people, gain power, or something else?

title: Agency - Resources
description: Pick two resource tags for the Agency:

title: Deal with the Agency (+Sharp)
description: When you deal with the Agency, requesting help or gear, or making excuses for a failure, roll +Sharp.

outcomes.text: You're good—your request for gear or personnel is okayed, or your slip-up goes unnoticed.
Things aren't so great. You might get chewed out by your superiors and there'll be fallout, but you get what you need for the job.
You screwed up: you might be suspended or under investigation, or just in the doghouse. You certainly aren't going to get any help until you sort it all out.

submoves.title: Starting Moves
submoves.description: You get all the basic moves, Deal with the Agency plus three other Professional moves.

title: Bottle It Up
description: If you want, you can take up to +3 bonus when you **act under pressure**. For each +1 you use, the Keeper holds 1. That hold can be spent later—one for one—to give you -1 on any move except **act under pressure**.

title: Battlefield Awareness
description: You always know what's happening around you, and what to watch out for. Take +1 armour (max 2-armour) on top of whatever you get from your gear.

title: Leave No One Behind (+Sharp)
description: In combat, when you help someone escape, roll +Sharp.

outcomes.text: You can either get them out or suffer no harm, you choose.
You fail to get them out and you've attracted hostile attention.

title: Tactical Genius
description: When you **read a bad situation**, you may roll +Cool instead of +Sharp.

title: Medic (+Cool)
description: You have a full first aid kit, and the training to heal people. When you do first aid, roll +Cool. This move takes the place of regular first aid.

outcomes.text: The patient is stabilized and healed of 2 harm.
Choose one: heal 2 harm or stabilize the injury.

title: Mobility
description: You have a truck, van, or car built for monster hunting. Choose two good things and one bad thing about it.

title: Gear - Armour
description: You get either a flak vest (1-armour hidden) or combat armour (2-armour heavy) for protection.

title: Gear - Serious Weapons
pickOne: Assault rifle (3-harm far area loud reload)
Grenade launcher (4-harm far area messy loud reload)
Submachine gun (3-harm close area loud reload)

title: Improvement
description: When you have filled all five experience boxes, you level up. Erase the marks and pick from below.
pick: Add a new resource tag for your Agency or change a red tape tag
Get command of an Agency team of monster hunters
Take a move from another playbook
Take a move from another playbook

title: Advanced Improvements
description: After you have leveled up *five* times, you additionally qualify for advanced improvements.
pick: Change this hunter to a new type
Create a second hunter to play as well as this one
Mark two of the basic moves as advanced
Mark another two of the basic moves as advanced
Get some or all of the other players' hunters hired by your agency. They get the deal with the agency move, as well as salary and benefits
Get back one used Luck point
